meanings.definition: Relating to meaning in language or logic.
meanings.sent1: The semantical analysis of the text helped us understand its deeper message.
meanings.sent2: She always pays attention to the semantical nuances in conversations.
meanings.sent3: The semantical debate between the two professors was both enlightening and entertaining.
meanings.sent4: His semantical approach to problem-solving opened up new possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The semantical significance of the symbol was not immediately apparent.

meanings.definition: Concerned with the meaning of words and phrases.
meanings.sent1: The semantical differences between synonyms can be subtle.
meanings.sent2: As a writer, she is very semantical in her choice of language.
meanings.sent3: The semantical discussion at the conference was surprisingly engaging.
meanings.sent4: His semantical exploration of the poem revealed hidden layers of interpretation.
meanings.sent5: The semantical richness of the language added depth to the story.
